acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 2 from 48 hours EC50=1.6mg/L of the crustacea (Daphnia magna) (CERI Hazard Data, 2002).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "solid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the LD50 value of 381mg/kg representing the lower of the two testing data of rat LD50 (oral route) of 381mg/kg and 512mg/kg (the Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare (1994)).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity was Category 2 and the bio-accumulation potential was low (BCF=83(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)), since there was no rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 4%(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)), it was classified into Category 2.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available.

explosives.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though the substance contains nitro groups, with its oxygen budget calculated at -96

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though classified as "flammable" by ICSC (1999)

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the absence of data on multi-generation/germ cell/somatic cell in vivo mutagenicity/genotoxicity tests and no positive data on mutagenicity tests in vitro (several indices), described in the Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare (1994) and SIDS (2005).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though being organic compounds containing oxygen bound to elements other than carbon and hydrogen.

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on no evidence of adverse effects on reproduction and development at doses producing parental toxicity observed in combined studies, described in SIDS (2005) and CERI Hazard Data 2000-42 (2001).

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available (melting point: 61degC (ICSC, 1999), test temperature: 140degC)

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though the substance contains nitro groups

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit skin irritation tests (HSDB (2005)): "The substance induced slight delipidation of the skin surface, with sloughing in days 7-10. At 24 hours, severe erythema and edema were evident. These irritant reactions gradually subsided and there was no injury in depth. The substance is thus considered to possess a severe skin irritation potential" (though the results are not those of 4-hour application).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (liver, kidney, blood)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies: "hepatocyte swelling, hyaline droplet/vacuolation of the renal tubular epithelium and increased hemosiderin deposition in the spleen were observed. Increases in urinary protein/serum sodium/protein/total cholesterol levels and decreased urea nitrogen levels were noted. In addition, decreased hemoglobin/ hematocrit values and reticulocytosis were detected, suggesting hemolytic anemia" (the Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare (1994)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies: "decreased locomotor activity, blepharoptosis, staggering, relaxation of the general muscles, skin achromasia and deep respiration were observed in a dose-dependent manner. Some deaths were observed 1-2 days after administration as the responses increased in severity and respiration weakened" (the Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare (1994)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1.
